newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Lobby settles with Hong Kong software pirates.
newsitem.headline: Lobby settles with Hong Kong software pirates.

text.p: An international software lobby said it had settled legal actions with four private Hong Kong companies that had admitted using unauthorised software.

The Business Software Alliance (BSA) said in a statement issued late on Friday that it had concluded legal actions against architectural firms Y.K. Au-Yeung and Associates, Andrew Lee King Fun & Associates, and AP Architects Ltd, and commercial college Far East Fame Ltd.
The companies involved were not immediately available for comment.
Under the terms of the settlements, the companies agreed to pay "substantial" costs and damages to the BSA, it said without giving any figures.
The companies had deleted the unlicensed software, bought their licensed versions and agreed to implement immediate control to prevent employees from making or using illegal software, it said.
BSA's worldwide members include the leading publishers of software for personal computers.
